授業目的: To obtain fluency and confidence in expressing yourself in English, and train guidance of others in English usages.
到達目標: The participant can produce well-argued texts. They can give an oral presentation. They can organize 45-minute class and teach their peers a topic in English.
授業方法:
３回目以降「Zoomによる同時双方向」で配信予定。授業開始5分前までにZoomへ入っておくこと。１４回目までは対面授業を継続予定。
Class instructions, group work, individual presentation and feedback. Writing and presentation assignments, including extensive reading, diary-keeping, and individual, longer oral presentations.

第1回: 04/13 Introduction to the course and ourselves.  Lesson One in the textbook. Assignment of the diary project: Keep a diary in English on LUNA 日誌. Write on average 5 entries @ 80 words per week for 10 weeks. Illustrations are accpeted, and can count 20 percent of an entry, if the relevance is made clear. The total of quotation in any entry should not exceed 20 percent of the entry; i.e., up to 16 words in a 80-word entry. All quotations, direct or indirect, must be marked or otherwise identified.

Start the diary. With the textbook, you will have access to MyEnglishLab full of exercises. Some of them will be assigned during the course, and should be completed within two weeks of assignment. Registration is necessary, but we will get it ready as soon as possible.
第2回: 04/20 Instruction on peer feedback. Produce a sample writing on "My best learning experience" - peer review.
Textbook exercises. Submit the rewritten version of "My best learning experience" on LUNA. Deadline: Sunday 25 April.
第3回: 04/27 Speech analysis - Steve Jobs' Commencement Speech at Stanford University. What makes a good speech?  Effective use of visuals.
For the next class, prepare a 7-minute speech in English on a topic you are familiar with. Use powerpoint for highligthing speaking points and illustrations. Not the full text.
第4回: 05/11 Oral presentations 1. 6 persons. Everybody should have their presentation ready, so she can give it any time she is called. The audience must give a feedback in writing, following the instructions.
第5回: 05/18 Oral presentations 2. 6 persons. Everybody should have their presentation ready, so she can give it any time she is called. The audience must give a feedback in writing, following the instructions.
第6回: 05/25  Picture analysis exercise. Description, analysis, deduction.
At home: write an analysis of the picture your have been assigned. Post your 300-word description, analysis, and deduction on LUNA, not later than Sunday 30 May.
第7回: 06/01 The audience, first and last. Work with the Textbook
第11回: 06/29 Work with the Textbook. Deadline for the diary.
第14回: M-Reader assignment: Read 70000 words and complete the online check, cf. instructions.
第15回: 09/21 Welcome back. The "Be a teacher - give a 45-minute class and teach the rest of us."-project. (May be shortened to 30-minute class, depending on the number of participants).
Prepare the class you will teach. Time managment is one of the challenges - the margine is one percent. More or less than that = lower grade.
第17回: 10/05 Be a teacher - give a 45-minute class and teach the rest of us. 2 persons. Peer feedback. When you have given your class and read the feedback from your peers, write and submit a report on that gives an outline of the class and highlights what went well, what you could improve, and how. The report is due on LUNA (課題レポート) one week after the presentation.
第18回: 10/12 Be a teacher - give a 45-minute class and teach the rest of us. 2 persons.
第19回: 10/19 Be a teacher - give a 45-minute class and teach the rest of us. 2 persons.
第20回: 10/26 Be a teacher - give a 45-minute class and teach the rest of us. 2 persons.
第21回: 11/02 Be a teacher - give a 45-minute class and teach the rest of us. 2 persons.
第22回: 11/09 Poster - group work; what is a poster, how does it communicate?
